result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary R. Noland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $200.00 a month beginning March 22, 2022.    Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary R. Noland

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

03:58 PM Defendant Gary R. Noland in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint and charges.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to an attorney.  Plea of no contest to misd. - bail jumping.    Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of misd - bail jumping.  Court orders court costs; DNA sample and surcharge. Costs shall be paid at the rate of $200.00 a month beginning March 22, 2022.   - rt

ADDRESS INFO for Gary R. Noland
Current: 541 3rd Street, #6, Rib Lake, WI 54470 United States  (Effective: 02-16-2022)
Prior: 541 N. 8th Street, Medford, WI 54451

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Initial Appearance set February 22, 2022 at 4:00 p.m.

10:13 am  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gary R. Noland appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting that the court keep the bonds that were ordered on the previous cases and not revoke those bonds.  The are case numbers 20CM94 and 21CT9.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a  $500.00 signature; booking and no possession or consumption of alcohol on the new charge of misd - bail jumping.  Court orders bond as requested.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 4:00 pm.  - rt
